com.appglu.android
Class AppGlu

java.lang.Object
  com.appglu.android.AppGlu

public final class AppGlu
extends Object

The central class for AppGlu Android SDK.

This is always going to be the starting point for doing anything with the AppGlu Android SDK.
It is a singleton and needs to be initialized before it is used.
It is recommended, but not required, to initialize it on your Application.onCreate() method like below:

AppGluSettings settings = new AppGluSettings("appKey", "appSecret");
AppGlu.initialize(this, settings);

To create the AppGluSettings class you will need your credentials to authenticate your account with AppGlu. This class also contains configuration and customization settings.

After AppGlu is initialized you will have access to AppGlu API classes. See the table below:

AppGlu methodAPI class description
crudApi()CrudApi contains create, read, update and delete operations to be applied on your tables
savedQueriesApi()SavedQueriesApi allow you to run your previously created SQLs on AppGlu and obtain the results
pushApi()PushApi is used to register / unregister the device making it eligible to receive push notifications
analyticsApi()AnalyticsApi is used to log events to AppGlu allowing it to collect mobile app usage statistics
userApi()UserApi has methods to login / logout and sign up new mobile app users
syncApi()SyncApi is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server
storageApi()StorageApi has methods to download and cache files from AppGlu server

All the API classes described on the table above provides two type of methods: synchronous and asynchronous.
A method that is asynchronous has the suffix inBackground and it always has an AsyncCallback as parameter.

For example, look at this synchronous method example:

Row row = AppGlu.crudApi().read("tableName", "rowId");

Be careful NOT to call this on the UI thread.
It will execute in the same thread as it is called. Use it inside your own AsyncTask or equivalent.

Now an asynchronous example:

AppGlu.crudApi().readInBackground("tableName", "rowId", new AsyncCallback() {
    public void onPreExecute() {

    }
    public void onResult(Row result) {

    }
    public void onException(ExceptionWrapper exceptionWrapper) {

    }
    public void onNoInternetConnection() {

    }
    public void onFinish() {

    }
});

Make sure to call this method ON the UI thread.
It will execute in a separated thread and return the result to the AsyncCallback.onResult(Object) method.

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
AppGluSettings

Field Summary
static String LOG_TAG
          Log tag used for all logging that the AppGlu Android SDK does
static String VERSION
          Current AppGlu Android SDK version
 
Method Summary
static AnalyticsApi analyticsApi()
          Returns a AnalyticsApi object that is used to log events to AppGlu allowing it to collect mobile app usage statistics.
static CrudApi crudApi()
          Returns a CrudApi object that contains create, read, update and delete operations to be applied on your tables.
static DeviceInstallation deviceInstallation()
          Returns a DeviceInstallation object that contains runtime information about the device that this application is running on.
static User getAuthenticatedUser()
          Returns the mobile app User authenticated or null if no user is authenticated.
static boolean hasInternetConnection()
          Returns true if the Internet connection is available on the device, false otherwise.
static void initialize(android.content.Context context, AppGluSettings settings)
          Initializes AppGlu singleton using AppGluSettings.
This must be called before using any other method of AppGlu class otherwise a AppGluNotInitializedException will be thrown.
static boolean isUserAuthenticated()
          Returns true if a mobile app user is authenticated either by signing up or logging in, false otherwise.
static PushApi pushApi()
          Returns a PushApi object that is used to register / unregister the device making it eligible to receive push notifications.
static SavedQueriesApi savedQueriesApi()
          Returns a SavedQueriesApi object that allow you to run your previously created SQLs on AppGlu and obtain the results.
static AppGluSettings settings()
          Returns the AppGluSettings previously used to initialize AppGlu.
static StorageApi storageApi()
          Returns a StorageApi object that has methods to download and cache files from AppGlu server.
StorageApi will use a default CacheManager implementation defined by using AppGluSettings.setDefaultStorageCacheManager(CacheManager).
If you do not set the default CacheManager implementation then FileSystemCacheManager is used.
static StorageApi storageApi(CacheManager storageCacheManager)
          Returns a StorageApi object that has methods to download and cache files from AppGlu server.
static SyncApi syncApi()
          Returns a SyncApi object that is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
To use the SyncApi with success you must first define the default SQLite database to be used using AppGluSettings.setDefaultSyncDatabaseHelper(SyncDatabaseHelper).
If the default database is not set then a AppGluNotProperlyConfiguredException will be thrown.
static SyncApi syncApi(SyncDatabaseHelper syncDatabaseHelper)
          Returns a SyncApi object that is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
static UserApi userApi()
          Returns a UserApi object that has methods to login / logout and sign up new mobile app users.

Method Detail

initialize

public static void initialize(android.content.Context context,
                              AppGluSettings settings)
Initializes AppGlu singleton using AppGluSettings.
This must be called before using any other method of AppGlu class otherwise a AppGluNotInitializedException will be thrown.

Parameters:
context - this can be an Activity or an Application object
settings - contains credentials and configuration settings
See Also:
AppGluSettings

hasInternetConnection

public static boolean hasInternetConnection()
Returns true if the Internet connection is available on the device, false otherwise.

isUserAuthenticated

public static boolean isUserAuthenticated()
Returns true if a mobile app user is authenticated either by signing up or logging in, false otherwise.

See Also:
UserApi.signup(User), UserApi.login(String, String), UserApi.logout()

getAuthenticatedUser

public static User getAuthenticatedUser()
Returns the mobile app User authenticated or null if no user is authenticated.

See Also:
UserApi.signup(User), UserApi.login(String, String), UserApi.logout()

settings

public static AppGluSettings settings()
Returns the AppGluSettings previously used to initialize AppGlu.

See Also:
initialize(Context, AppGluSettings), AppGluSettings

UserApi

syncApi

public static SyncApi syncApi()
Returns a SyncApi object that is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.
To use the SyncApi with success you must first define the default SQLite database to be used using AppGluSettings.setDefaultSyncDatabaseHelper(SyncDatabaseHelper).
If the default database is not set then a AppGluNotProperlyConfiguredException will be thrown.

See Also:
SyncApi

syncApi

public static SyncApi syncApi(SyncDatabaseHelper syncDatabaseHelper)
Returns a SyncApi object that is used to synchronize the data in your local SQLite tables with the AppGlu server.

Parameters:
syncDatabaseHelper - the SQLite database to be used by SyncApi
See Also:
SyncApi

storageApi

public static StorageApi storageApi()
Returns a StorageApi object that has methods to download and cache files from AppGlu server.
StorageApi will use a default CacheManager implementation defined by using AppGluSettings.setDefaultStorageCacheManager(CacheManager).
If you do not set the default CacheManager implementation then FileSystemCacheManager is used.

See Also:
StorageApi

storageApi

public static StorageApi storageApi(CacheManager storageCacheManager)
Returns a StorageApi object that has methods to download and cache files from AppGlu server.

Parameters:
storageCacheManager - Defines the CacheManager implementation to be used by StorageApi
See Also:
StorageApi
